result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross W Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ross W Weber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ross W Weber was found guilty of Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution of $500.00 for Value Care and $1,857.99 to Mutual Insurance (joint and several) Total of $2,357.99 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any victim, business or co-actors.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ross W Weber in court, in custody, with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

12 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 506 days)
  -  8 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*No Use controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  any victim, businesses or co-actors
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
RESTITUTION: Jointly and severally  $500.00 Value Care $1857.99 Mutual Insurance (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);
DRGOD Surcharge: $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
